Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio tied the game in the eighth with his second homer of the night
Garrett Mitchell delivered a two-run shot later in the inning to give the Milwaukee Brewers a 5-3 victory
Post-Match Reflections: Milwaukee trailed 3-2 when Chourio led off the eighth by homering to right-center off losing pitcher Phil Maton, making his fourth appearance on the mound in five days
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams will play a decisive Game 3 on Thursday night. The Brewers will attempt to become the first team to win a best-of-three Wild Card Series after losing the opener since MLB went to this expanded playoff format in 2022
Others: Devin Williams retired the side in order in the ninth to earn the save
Joe Ross picked up the win after pitching 1 1/3 innings of scoreless relief
Rookie RHP Tobias Myers (9-6, 3.00 ERA) will start for Milwaukee in Game 3 against LHP Jose Quintana (10-10, 3.75)
